page.title: 14Rodbourne Village & Church
page.content: Rodbourne is a small scattered village of old Cotswold stone houses.It has trees and wide verges each side of the main street.Parsloe Farm,the Church,an old school and a stone cross are near the centre of the village,which is overlooked by{Rodbourne House}and a water tower.{Sir John Pollen}lives near the old school & owns most of the land and farms.There is little going on in the village to-day because there is no shop,Post Office, Sunday School or new residential development.{Holy {Rood Church}has 2 Norman doorways and 2 stained glass windows made in 1863 by{William Morris.}The tower has a saddle-back roof and a bell dated 1654.{Rev.G.Oswald}is Vicar of Rodbourne, Corston and Seagry and Rector of the Somerfords.Services are held every 2 weeks at Rodbourne and Corston where{Angela Payne}is organist
